title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Brockton, MA) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: I had a disappointing experience with the application process for the Research Assistant, Bilingual in Spanish position. While I have always been enthusiastic about contributing to research and working with this company, my experience was negative. After submitting my application, it took approximately a month to receive a response for an interview, which I understood and remained excited about. However, during the interview at the Brockton, Massachusetts location, the interviewer displayed extreme rudeness, rushed through my responses, and asked an inappropriate question. Unfortunately, this led me to decide not to proceed with the interview. I acknowledge that this isolated incident does not reflect the company as a whole, as I still believe it is a great organization to work for. However, I believe it is important to share my experience to potentially benefit other applicants. Throughout my career, I have undergone numerous interviews and have never encountered anything negative or felt compelled to leave a negative review. However, in this particular case, I felt compelled to share my experience. I am uncertain whether I was a victim of discrimination, if the interviewer was having a difficult day, or what exactly led to this encounter. Regardless, I genuinely wish the company continued success and fervently hope that the research being conducted will make a positive impact.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for this company?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: The first interview consisted of meeting with supervisors, and they described the role. I was only asked basic questions and to give background on myself. Then, I had a phone call with HR where they went over the benefits packet, and asked me more logistical questions. The next interview involved 3 members of the team and they asked many experience based questions where I had to give examples. Then directly after that I met with two current CRCs and asked them questions about the role. The next day, I had a phone call with HR where they offered me the job. Overall, a very quick, low-stress interview process. The questions were very standard, and it definitely felt more conversation based with you being able to ask lots of questions about the role as well.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to work with a difficult colleague.

title: Nursing Informatics Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Video chat interview with the informatics director. She was very nice and told me about the position. Essentially she is looking to expand the nursing informatics team, since currently she is the only one. This position requires the candidate to travel to several different ambulatory sites and therefore requires the candidate have a car and driver's license. The informatics director is very nice and passionate about her work. Their sites use Epic EHR, and candidates are expected to have experience with Epic EHR use (particularly in ambulatory sites). The candidate will also be expected to participate in go-lives of new systems.

I did not get an offer, but what was confusing was that I received an automatically generated rejection letter from HR while their careers website stated I was still under consideration. I tried to follow up to clarify what this meant, but HR was not clear in their response to me. It has been awhile since my interview and I have not heard anything since, so I am assuming that I did not receive an offer. If you are applying to this position, I recommend closely following up with HR.

Also, having an MA nursing license from the get-go is a requirement. I did not have one and although I am eligible to apply for one, I feel that negatively impacted my chances at this opportunity. Most informatics nurse positions only require applicants to be eligible for licensure in the organization's state (and apply for licensure after being hired) so please be aware of this requirement.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to apply to Dana-Farber?

title: Research Assistant I—Population Sciences  Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was really disappointed in my interview process at Dana Farber. It was for a research assistant I position in a small lab, so an entry level job for someone newly out of college or looking for experience. As someone who was newly out of college and really struggling to find jobs in the health world in Boston, the process really further discouraged me. At first it took about a month to receive any follow up from my application, which at that point I just assumed it had been a rejection since no reply seemed to be the norm for RA jobs here and at other hospitals I've applied to, so I was really excited to hear back at all. We scheduled for a short 15 minute informational call, which after I was feeling even more excited about the job, hearing more information about what exactly the lab was studying (the original positing didn't have much info about the specific studies and research -just general psycho social research on cancer outcomes and treatment experience). This phone call was with the current RA in the lab and went well, but she was also honest that  they had a lot of applications so I still wasn't expecting much (but felt the role would be perfect for me and thought the phone call went great). I followed up with a long email explaining more of my qualifications and interest and got a response about a week later that I would move onto the next round, this time a zoom interview with the current RA and the doctor in charge of the lab. Again, I thought the interview went great and was really excited, but still didn't get my hopes up too much as I knew there were a lot of applicants. The interview was nothing out of the ordinary with standard questions about my interest and experience and how I prioritize work, communication styles, etc. Both the doctor and RA were very nice and engaging and I was hopeful and excited after the interview. The RA told me that they would be in touch in a "few weeks" and that they would let me know definitely one way or another and lamented how she knew it was really frustrating being ghosted by employers, which was nice to hear. I sent another follow up email soon after to thank them for their time and recap the conversation etc. I quickly received a positive email back from the RA saying they enjoyed speaking to me, thanks for the note, and the would be in touch. About two days later I received an email from DF HR about references. This is where I feel the interview/hiring process became a little ridiculous and unfair to applicants. They asked me to provide 5 professional references for a "short" survey within 24 hours. This email was sent on a Friday afternoon... making 24 hours especially difficult. 5 references is a lot, I think 3 is usually standard and this is for an ENTRY level job straight out of college. I have not even had 5 bosses and didn't have 5 people at the drop of a hat to ask to fill out what DF referred to as a short survey. So, as I was really excited about this job, I was frantically emailing and texting old bosses, coworkers, and professors to ensure they would be willing to fill out this survey. Once I had 5 sure references, I put them into the system for them to receive the survey as an email. This took me about 36 hours (email originally said to please provide in 24 hours, but since the email was sent late afternoon on a Friday, I thought they might be more lenient about the 24 hour window, but I did receive a reminder email 24 hours stating that I had failed to provide the references and to please  do it ASAP). So after finding these 5 references and giving them all the instructions about what email they would receive and how to fill out the survey (which I had originally told them would be a SHORT survey because that is what the email told me - come to find out it was actually about a 25 question survey asking to rate me on a variety of topics and skills, with room for comments - which in my opinion is not what I would call a short survey and is not really the professional norm for what would be expected of references.) At this point, I'm frustrated, but also really excited because I thought if they needed my references this quickly, it meant I was most likely a final candidate and was really excitedly waiting for next steps. Well, I was wrong because after this DF ghosted me for a full month until I finally sent a follow up email to  restate my interest and ask if they were still in the hiring process or had concluded. I received a short email about 3 days later confirming they had hired someone. After I had scrambled to find references and had them fill out a long detailed survey, I was ghosted and rejected. Makes me embarrassed to reach out to references again for other jobs as it is clear I was rejected from this job and they already generously gave me their time on this long, detailed survey, putting me and them in an awkward position and making my further job search even more difficult.
Interview Questions:
How do you delegate your time when facing multiple important tasks and projects? 
What is your interest and experience in this kind of work?

title: Clinical Scheduling Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I heard back from Dana Farber about two months after I applied. I first met with a recruitment coordinator who did an initial phone screen with me.   I then interviewed a week later with the clinical scheduling manager.  Both interviews were very pleasant and went well, although they were quite lengthy and the exact same questions were asked. The clinical scheduling manager quickly followed up the next day with me to schedule a third interview with two other clinical scheduling specialists with whom I would work. The two clinical scheduling specialists were not as friendly and seemed either uninterested or unprepared for my interview. Still, the third interview went alright. Followed up with the clinical scheduling manager to discuss next steps and never heard back. For a prestigious institution such as Dana Farber, not even bothering to send a reply email or following up with a phone call is the height of unprofessionalism and rudeness. Three lengthy interviews is a substantial block of time and misleading for potential job seekers. I would not recommend the interview process to others—it took about three months to finish the application and interview process only to not even receive an email saying that I was not moving forward to the next steps in the hiring process.
Interview Questions:
Q: What are your strengths and weaknesses?
Q: Tell me about why you think you would be a good fit for this position.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to interview with the P.I. soon after submitting an application. Interviews were relatively short and less formal than I expected; unfortunately, there were a lot of technical issues, so that likely did not help things.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in our lab?

title: Clinic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: Good, in depth, need to know job description and be confident for best results. You should also be prepared to describe how you handle stress, how you organize, and how you work work others.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite hobby?

title: Clinical Trial Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Overall the interview was pleasant. Due to COVID it was performed via zoom with two other company employees. If you make it to the second round, you are interviewed with the PI
Interview Questions: Name 3 personalities that you don't get along with well and how you deal with that.

title: Clinical Research Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: 3 informal unstructured interview (30 min) with PI, Program Administrator, and Senior Research Project Manager. Asked for 5 references (skill set survey): 2 from supervisor, 3 from coworkers. All of this was asked before talking/discussing with HR further details such as hours, benefits, compensation.
Interview Questions:
1) Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
2) What are your career goals?
3) Why do you want this position?
4) Are you okay with working independently?
5) Are you okay with the position being 40% meetings?

title: Clinic Coordinator I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: 2-3 rounds typically. HR will screen you with a phone call, ~30 mins but often less. Then they pass you on to the floor that is hiring. Meeting with 2-4 other people who work on the team, often semi-casual and laid back. Good interview
Interview Questions:
How do you work under pressure?
Strengths and weaknesses?
What would you do if the phone was ringing, there was a patient in front of you, and you had a provider behind you asking a question?
How do you feel about working in PPE?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: The manager first went into details with me explaining the responsibilities of the this job and then she asked if I have any questions. She then also asked me questions about why I want this position and what I wish to get out of this position.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to work as a clinical research coordinator?

title: Clinic Coor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone call with Recruiter. Zoom interview with team, about 3 people. Call at the end of the week. Was a very straight forward process, asked mainly about background skills.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you dealt with an unhappy customer/patient, how did you handle it?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: Was asked for zoom interview directly with PI due to COVID. It was pretty laid back and they just wanted to get to know your background essentially to see if you fit their criteria. I honestly didn’t feel like I was a good match because they mostly work with cancer cells of course them being cancer institute so I recommend you apply if you have a background working with that.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Following my application on their website, I received an email asking for an interview. The video interview  was with the lab PI, where I was asked to describe my previous experience and research at my undergrad lab.
Interview Questions: Research background questions and some general background of myself

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: Had a couple quick phone interviews then an in person meeting with members of the lab and the PI. A lot of time passed between each of these steps so make sure you reach out -- I think there is a lot of bureaucracy and hoops that have to be jumped through even for entry level research assistants.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Clinic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Had an initial phone interview/screen with a recruiter. Then went on to have a zoom interview with the practice manager, which went really well. Then, had to send in 5 references and had them fill out a survey. Didn’t hear anything for a little bit, so I followed up and did a 2nd zoom interview with the team leads. Didn’t hear anything after 2 weeks, followed up again, didn’t get the position :)). Would’ve been nice if they were better at following up with candidates or telling me earlier in the process, just my two cents.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a clinic coordinator?

title: Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted for a phone screen and then did not hear anything back. I contacted the person back about the status and they said that position had been filled but would I like to be considered for similar positions in other departments; I said yes of course. 
Two weeks later, I receive a request for references. They wanted five people to fill out a reference survey online etc. After I completed the references, I notified my contact person. She said she "would forward it to the hiring team." I am writing this three weeks later with no update and no response to my inquiries. 
Since then they have continued to post similar job openings that I am more than qualified for; these positions don't require a degree which I have.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: They are very friendly and it was a brief interview. They explain the job well and how your experience aligns with their requirements. They asked for a presentation on my research skills and experience and the projects I have done.
Interview Questions: What is your Research experience

title: Software Engineering Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly smooth. It was around covid so there was some panic about hiring freezes but I ended up making the deadline. The interviwerers were nice and caring. Wanted you to succeed.
Interview Questions: They asked about past experiences

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: First, I had a phone interview with a member of the research team. I was then invited to a video interview to meet the team (conducted virtually, due to COVID-19). Then, I spoke with a recruiter. I sent in 5 references for the position. I had to follow up to be told that the position had been offered to another candidate.
Interview Questions: What draws you to this position?

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Like so many others, it came with a phone screen about 15 mins from an HR representative followed by an invitation to an in-person interview. Due to the COVID situation so everything was done on zoom. I talked with the PI and current statistician for a total of 90 minutes and can't say I feel anything wrong about the interview. After two weeks, I got contacted by the same HR for reference checking from 5 persons (2 managers and 3 co-workers) which was required to be submitted within one day.  Later, a denial letter saying they found someone more appropriate came after another two weeks. 

Overall speaking, their interview process is neither bad nor good but I just hated it when they asked for reference checking but rejected my application afterward.  Sorry for the trouble I caused to those five persons vouching for me.
Interview Questions: They gave me a real-time stat test to show my capability of data manipulation and statistical procedures.

title: Data Scientists II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very professional.  Behavioral questions.  Technical coding challenge.  Talked to multiple people on the team.  Positive experience overall.  Very professional.  Behavioral questions.  Technical coding challenge.  Talked to multiple people on the team.  Positive experience overall.
Interview Questions: Reverse a list of integers

title: Clinical Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Many interviews between multiple sites, was made to seem as though I was going to get an offer then after being brought back and contacted by DFCI to apply for a job that they “want me for” I was strung along for months interviewing repeatedly and I was told to go ahead and get a MA license ASAP so they could move forward and I could be reimbursed after hire (I did that immediately) so I wasted $400
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict

title: Data Scientist Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was good and smooth. There are two rounds of interviews in total. The first one go through resume projects, the second one is a presentation of past project.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself Why choose healthcare

title: Research Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process was around 3-4 weeks total. Started with a call from a project manager, followed with a 30 min phone call, then a 2 hour meeting with 4 people, ending with a screening from HR
Interview Questions: What is an example of when you faced adversity, and how did you respond?

title: Resource Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and organized.  I met first in a one-on-one and then with the group.  It was professional and relaxed. I felt comfortable through the whole process.
Interview Questions: How do you best keep organized?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty informal and was about 45 minutes long. The interviewer asked a variety of questions and then gave time for the questions to be asked about the program.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this internship?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a quick interview over the phone and lasted about 10 to 15 minutes. The recruiter asked several interpersonal questions and did not receive any feedback regarding the job opportunity. It was an ok experience over all.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you have a challenge while working on a project?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I thoroughly enjoyed my interview with the pharmacy team on site, however, I did find HR’s business practices to be questionable. I had references from my earliest days in pharmacy all the way through my current employer. That being said, HR “requested” a reference from a company who had been bought out 10 times over. I had not kept in touch and wasn’t able to locate anyone to be a reference. Due to that, none of my references were considered. The others were completely overlooked for something that was out of my control and I don’t feel that was taken into consideration. I found that unfair to the SIX other references that really went to bat for me and believe in me to be completely overlooked over something so trivial. If DFCI HR sees this, please revise your business practices if you want good talent. Faulting someone for something completely out of their control is unfair and isolating. I will advise others in the industry to really think about what DFCI 
is offering prior to applying. Pay is very low and the skill trade off isn’t worth the low pay and bad schedule. Also, HR uses the same pharmacy reps across all sites. Please look elsewhere unless you’re only looking to stay a short amount of time in the role.
Interview Questions: Work history, skills acquired, I was not asked any behavioral questions.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: After a preliminary interview with the group leader, I did an on-site interview for full day and had a chance to meet everyone in the group.  I talked to each person for about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to switch fields to biology?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: I was the last to be interviewed by the head of the laboratory I was applying to work for. She was extremely pleasant and nice throughout. She showed me around the labs towards the end, but I did not get the position. I was not experienced in animal husbandry, which was a primary responsibility for the technician role.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by an in person 2 hour interview. They were accommodating and laid back.  I met with 5 people in total, including my possible peers. The PI sought my opinion and recommendations to hypothetical team projects, issues.
Interview Questions: Unique input I would bring to the team.

title: Regulatory Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Application HR phone screen, departmentvphone screen, in person department interview, reference check discussion with HR and withdrew application.  Very friendly bright high achieving staff. No faculty were there. Unique in references were requested first via email survey. Requested five references within 24 hours of receiving the emailed reference check form.
Interview Questions: Can you commit to more than one year oin what is considered an important but transitional/ early career role?

title: Licensing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: People were friendly and welcome. They tried to smoothen the process for you. First had two individual meetings with two seniors. Then was invited to meet the team on-site in several 1-1 meetings.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time when you dealt with uncertainty/ambiguity.
Tell me about a time when you disagreed with a team member.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took about a week. No phone interview.  There was a huge lack of communication between their hiring manager and the talent acquisition team which led to a negative experience. I received an email from the talent acquisition team asking about my availability for an on-site interview. I let them know about my availability and two days after, I received an email from the hiring manager asking why I didn't show up to the interview!!! I explained the situation and told him that I actually never received a confirmation email about the date or time of the interview. They rescheduled. When I got there, they were not ready at all! Hiring manager was running around and he was constantly checking his phone during the interview. When I asked him about the responsibilities of the job, he didn't give me a clear answer and changed the subject!
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions about your background and experience

title: Human Resources Analytics Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute phone screen with HR, 1 hour phone interview with the manager, 4 hour in-person interview with the manager and other stakeholders. Most of the conversations were around the role and how my experiences would be relevant. Received some hypothetical situational questions, but nothing too difficult. Everyone was really nice and helpful.
Interview Questions: If you received a request that conflicts with people holding the info, how would you handle that situation?

title: Protocol Care Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had a three step interview, one with the supervisor, some clinical coordinators, and then with a head doctor. A bit intimidating but the supervisor warned me beforehand. Overall i was able to get a better understanding of the role and was glad i got the offer.
Interview Questions: Why I was leaving my old job

title: Data Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Applied in March via the website. Two months later got a phone call from the hiring manager and had a great conversation. Then I spoke with HR, and again, they were very welcoming and asked a lot of great questions and seemed very interested in my skills and experience for the role.  I was asked to submit 5 references within 24 hours of receiving the email. 
I was then asked to drive 6 hours to interview with the team of 9 people at my own expense. Interviews were very well scheduled and laid out.  I left the interview with a very positive experience and had fantastic conversations with everyone.  They all seemed very interested in me and spoke highly of me and what I would bring to the team. 
I followed up with a thank you email the next day.  Two weeks later, after not getting a response from my original email, I emailed again asking for an update. The hiring manager, Sarah, sent me a very generic email and said they are pursuing another candidate. After all of the effort, I expected a bit more courtesy. I would not apply to this company again.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a decision where you are being asked by two different people for data, but competing for different end results.

title: Research Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy and straight forward, got to know the role a bit more and met with the department employees. It felt more like they wanted to know me more as a person than an employee
Interview Questions: Asked about my prior work and why I would be a good fit for this position

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted two weeks after I submitted my application. The first interview was a phone interview, followed by a Skype interview with two project managers, followed by a final phone interview with the PI.
Interview Questions:
Q: Why do you want to work at Dana-Farber? 
Q: Describe one challenge with your current position and how you overcame it?
Standard interview questions!

title: Intake Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was much more casual than expected. In general, the in-person interview process was very conversational and friendly.  They really want to know your motivations for applying to Dana Farber Cancer Institute.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for DFCI

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: They met me in the lobby, brought me to a conference room and we basically had a free flowing discussion about my background and what the position's responsibilities were. It was a friendly environment and everyone was easy to talk with.
Interview Questions: Why I was interested in the role?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very smooth and professional. Demonstrated interest was expressed after the application process on the part of the employer, and HR was very quick to move the hiring process along.
Interview Questions: Why this research, how does your background and core values contribute to our goals?

title: Clinical Administrative Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process was quick. One interview with the manager of the department. Then met with two people from HR. I was a little nervous but the women from HR were very nice.
Interview Questions: Basic behavioral interview questions. Nothing job specific.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: The computer system is very tricky. It will deny many people through the system. I talk to people inside from dana farber, they agreed with that.  Make sure you say you do not sponsorship in the future. Otherwise, the system will automatically let you out.
Interview Questions: Do you need sponsorship in the future?

title: Clinical Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very casual.  They asked about my background, told me about the position, and then showed me around the floor.  I met with the Nurse Director and with the Lead Clinical Assistant.  I was offered the job within a week of my interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I sat down in a conference room with 4 people, which included the Clinical Research Manager and Associate Director of Clinical Research.   The Director asked the typical interview questions and then the rest of the staff were able to ask me anything they liked.
Interview Questions: How do you work in a team?

title: Revenue Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening and then an in person interview with 2 managers. Lasted 2 hours. It was quick and easy and the managers were very nice.  Asked for recommendations the day after. Received a job offer the day after that.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I received an email from the research manager with an interest in my application. We had a brief phone interview, which I thought went well, but I was not offered a  follow-up interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very straightforward.  I was able to do the interview process virtually, due to being out of the country, and they were very accomodating (this was pre-covid).  I had two interviews before being offered the internship, one with my immediate supervisor and one with the director of the department I would be working in.
Interview Questions:
They asked very standard interview questions, nothing I haven't heard before. 
Examples: 
- Describe your past education and job experience
- Have you ever experienced a challenge? If so, how did you overcome it?

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: Came in and there were 2 opportunities I was interested in so they let me apply for both.  The interviews were not bad and they were really a great chance to speak with the teams and learn more about internal processes.
Interview Questions: Strengths, weaknesses, multitasking.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Brief Phone interview with CRC, In-Person interview with Physician and other members of team. Followed up with reference check survey and phone conversation with recruiter. Had to input 5 different people. Then the waiting game came, 3 weeks later the offer came via phone call from the physician
Interview Questions: How would you describe your ability to handle stressful situations?

title: Director of Annual Fund Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: There were a series of interviews, a combination of on the phone and in person. I met with the HR staff, hiring manager, and a panel of other staff members from the department. There was also a skills assessment as part of the interview process.
Interview Questions: What professional accomplishment are you most proud of?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took a long time. I met four different groups of people and was asked a lot of questions about organization and time management etc. It was an overall good and fair experience.
Interview Questions: What is a stressful situation you have been in and how did you handle it

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy. Hire mostly recent graduates. Basic interview questions and ask you about your resume.  The process isn't difficult. The manger, other CRCs and MDs will interview you separately.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? What are your strengths/weaknesses?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: Thirty minute phone interview following application submission. Role was competitive, and was first step of hiring process. Total process was estimated to be four to six weeks. Didn't get offer.
Interview Questions: What are former projects you worked on that relate to this role?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: It was a standard process. I was first contacted to do a phone interview. It was then followed by an in-person interview, where I met the managers as well as the physician who was in charge of the clinical research program in the specific disease group
Interview Questions: What made you interested in this position? What are your strengths? What are you weaknesses?  Tell me about your past experience at XYZ.

title: Senior Clinical Research Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Got a quick email to request in in person interview.  Went for interview and it went well and was asked if I could stay for a second interview.  Was told a decision would be made within 2 weeks because they wanted to fill the role fast.  I checked back and there was a delay in the process.  After about a month a so I was told "they decided to go in a different direction".  Not sure exactly what that meant and the role is will on the website with a second financial analyst role available as well.  I wish they had better feed back on why I didn't qualify for the role.
Interview Questions: Why I was interested in this role.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: Had a pre-screening interview with HR and a phone interview with the PI the following week. Soon after came in for an in person interview and got a job offer. The whole process took about 1 month.
Interview Questions: General questions about past research and techniques

title: Development Officer, Special Events Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Poor communication for such a strong organization. Jobs still posted on their website that have been filled for months. No application update statues or way of getting in touch with actual representatives.
Interview Questions: What type of work do you want to do

title: Administrative Support Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Short and sweet basic interview questions, can be found on many reviews here. Two rounds of interviews, including meeting doctors you will support. Easy to answer questions if you know your resume well.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress?

title: Regulatory Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: After seeing my resume, they brought me in for an in-person interview that consisted of speaking with 2 different team members. All of the questions were fairly straightforward and were not tricky or technical. They emphasized the ability to stay organized and to communicate with different entities.
Interview Questions: Why Dana Farber?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: After going through a preliminary screening via a brief telephone interview, I was brought in and interviewed face-to-face with the head of the lab, and then several members of the lab afterwards.  They showed me around their lab and described what the position would entail and the general responsibilities of the job would be should I have gotten the offer.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next five years?

title: Clinical Genomics Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: A casual interview (skype) with hiring manager +1. They were keen on knowing my experience with cancer biology, whether I've taken cancer biology classes. They asked for writing samples and samples of my previous non-clinical  genetics reports.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was first contacted by the director of the specific lab I applied to via email.  I had a brief phone interview, and received an invitation to an on-site interview a week later (after I followed up with an email).  The interview was quite relaxed, and there were no difficult or unexpected questions.
Interview Questions: How do you interact with other members in a group?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed in April first over the phone and then was invited in for a second in person interview. The first interview was with the supervisor and the second was with the supervisor and the team. The team was very friendly and made me feel comfortable. I have not heard back yet.
Interview Questions: What are plans you have for the future?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I first had a 30 minute phone with the PI who was very pleasant and friendly. I was first asked to explain my research experience and the lab methods that I am familiar with. Then the PI explained the position and the research done in the lab. I discussed how my interests, goals, and abilities match the position. Then I was offered an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Previous research experience? What techniques are you familiar with?

title: Corporate Partnerships Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward, HR phone screen, in person interview with the hiring manager and then a second interview follow up . I was told I was a strong candidate and then after following up multiple times after two weeks of no updates, I was told I didn’t fit the candidate description.
Interview Questions: Why Dana Farber?

title: Program Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: HR called and did a phone screen first. Then I came in to meet with HR. Then I came to meet in with the nurse director. Then I came in to meet the disease center clinical team.
Interview Questions: Why do I want this job

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Initially applied for job and was reached out to by HR for a 20-30 minute phone screening. Was then asked to come in for in person interview, met with 7 people usually two at a time. Relaxed atmosphere, explained job and expectations well.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Dana Farber?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: First met with Management, then with supervisors, then with potential coworkers.  They would go over the day to day activities and responsibilities and would weave in general questions about your personal abilities and experience.  They also ask you if you are willing to handle some of the negative aspects of the job.  Overall, the interviews are more conversational rather than directive and inquisitive.
Interview Questions: What do you want to get out of this job?

title: Inpatient Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: starts with a quick telephone interview to discuss opportunities in the company and open positions.   For inpatient, you get to shadow rounds with the teams in the morning and meet with the chiefs after for interviews.
Interview Questions: They ask you how you about your experience giving bad news, handling very sick patients, etc, dealing with cancer patients in general.  The rest of the interview is pretty standard questions about your experience, being a team player, etc.   They do hire a lot of new grads, so if you had a rotation in oncology, ICU or inpatient medicine, you're in great shape.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by HR to set up a phone interview, then contacted by lab manager to come into the lab to meet lab members and tour the lab, was then offered the position
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this lab?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I received an email from the lab manager asking for more information and references. The PI then requested a Skype interview, which was followed a week later by an in person interview with the laboratory manager.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions:
1.  Screening interview with a member from HR.
The interview with the member of HR lasted approximately thirty minutes. The interviewer was very pleasant and asked non-technical questions.
2. Interview with the PI in whose lab you would be working.
The interview with the PI lasted an hour and was more technical. The interview focused on research background, skills, interests, and the project in the lab.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position? Why Boston?

title: Clinical Administrative Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Required more than one onsite evaluation.  Sat with Manager, then peers, and then also medical team.  Did not compensate parking for all these visits.  They were looking for a longterm employee that would commit extra hrs into getting the work done.
Interview Questions: What qualities and experience do you bring to the table?

title: New Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screening and then an in-person interview. The process was very straightforward and it did not take long for the hiring manager and the supervisor to get back to me. My in-person interview was less than thirty minutes long and received an offer an hour later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past work experiences

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Talked to a recruiter/ administrative assistant on the phone for some basic questions such as "what are your 3 best skills". Interviewed in person with head of department and then had an informal interview with person who was leaving that role.
Interview Questions:
Describe your 3 best skills
Tell me about yourself

title: Senior Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Brookline, MA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: 2 to 3 hours. I was an internal transfer, so interviews were spread across multiple days in 30-60 minute intervals. Group interview with team. 1:1 interviews with direct manager and each of the two levels of management above.
Interview Questions: What are you passionate about?

title: Protocol Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was good, but way too fast. They didnt care much about the interview rather than just getting me hired so i can do the work because they were tight on workload.
Interview Questions: How do you manage time

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview procedure- two in person interviews and one interview over the phone. Whole process took only a week. The staff here is very friendly even during interviews. Over the phone interview was only general hr questions while the in person interviews asked more relevant questions. No questions were meant to trip you up however.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this role?

title: Administrator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds of interviews with the different departments you would be in communication with. It was typical cookie cutter interview questions. At least 2 hours. By the end it was exhausting being asked the same questions by the different groups.
Interview Questions: What was your biggest challenge and biggest accomplishment. What can you bring to this company? What are your long term goals?

title: Laboratory Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I saw the job posting and contacted them directly via email. An hour later they emailed back for an in person interview. After 2.5 hours of interview with a MD and a Deputy Director, they contacted my references right that day. The next day (Friday) I scheduled to interview with the PI on Monday at noon. Monday afternoon I was offered the position. It was a very smooth and efficient process.
Interview Questions: What do you want to be when you grow up?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with everyone in the lab briefly, and we discussed ongoing projects in the laboratory. Everyone was pleasant, receptive, and they gave me a tour of their facilities. Definitely be up-to-date on the relevant literature to  their lab's work and be prepared with questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: They have an extremely long interview process. They ask you to block out at least 2 hours to come in and essentially do what would be you first and second round interviews one after another.
Interview Questions: What was the worst boss you have ever had and why?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview and two in-person interviews, held back-to-back. The phone interview was more or less just further explanation of the position. The first in-person interview was almost inappropriately informal - just sitting in a room with three other staff chatting. The second in-person interview was one-on-one and the interviewer asked a number of very simple questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself; What are your greatest strengths and weaknesses?; What are your career goals?.

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application, a few days later received an email from human resource to set up a phone interview. We set up a time. The day comes, the human resource woman calls me ahead of time to re-schedule the interview/make sure she has the right number, she tells me she'll call me back in a couple of hours. She never called back, didn't even email me. What a terrible way to do business. Was happy I accepted a position at another company instead.
Interview Questions: Was not asked any questions

title: Lead Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter by email to fill out a prescreening questionnaire. After that I was informed my file has been sent to the department and if there is interest I would be contacted by email. I got a response from the department the next week and scheduled a skype interview. Things went well and interview lasted a little over an hour. I was told they need me to speak to the Lab head who was away on tour for a couple of weeks. But I was contacted the very next week to setup time to talk to the lab head. Again another skype interview. It was merely a formality I felt and things went great. I was informed there are additional candidates to be interviewed and they would get back to me in a week. But within 3 days I was offered the job and I accepted gladly.
Interview Questions: General questions about my experience. If I worked with animals, if I was ok with working on occasional weekends etc

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I had two interviews one through phone and one onsite for a position at Lurie imaging center. They invited me for an onsite interview, they were so lethargic that they did not even care for a guy who visited from west coast, many of those interviewers were absent on that day and that guy Nyegen and Lei Quin, were so ignorant of what they have been doing in their own imaging field, lack of knowledge.  I was not sure how these guys manage this center without even knowing basic knowledge of imaging and cancer.  

When I went there for an interview, nobody knows in that center that there is a candidate, arrived for the interview. The interviewing guys came late than the candidate and it was a colossal total waste of time and energy,  They were so unprofessional and unethical.  A prospecting candidate for any position there should think twice before applying for the position there.

I am glad now that i did not want to work under a kid like them for rest of my life.
Interview Questions: why are you leaving?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was relatively easy and standard postdoctoral research fellow interview for an academic position, i was invited to give presentation to research group, had 1:1 meetings with PI, other postdocs and graduate students. it was a full day process, and had lunch with all group. during the day, I was asked about my projects and my grad school life, and questions about my personality
Interview Questions: how to set up an assay about this?

title: New Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for a phone interview by HR, and then brought in for an in-person interview with the same member of HR. The interview lasted about 45 minutes, and at the end of it she had me interview with my potential boss and the person who would be training me on the job. Those two interviews were about 30 minutes each. They then reached out to me via phone to discuss the interview, as I was being considered for multiple positions. After our phone conversation they offered me a position the next day.
Interview Questions:
How do you stay organized?
Why do you want to work in this role?
Tell me about a time when you worked with a difficult patient.
Tell me about a time when you handled a coworker being difficult.
How do you think this clinical experience on your resume will prepare you for an administrative role?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Process started with a phone screen, then once that was passed there was one more phone screen and a morning of in-person interviews. The interview was easy and was based more on if your personality worked with the team, once they did the initial scan to make sure you were qualified.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself?
Why this company?
Future goals?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth and welcoming. I never felt uncomfortable or as if I was imposing on anyone. There are multiple interviews with the various PIs and current CRCs. Initial phone screening was smooth.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: New Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial phone call with someone from HR, we then scheduled a time to meet in person. HR called back to schedule me an interview with the hiring manager of the department (it was scheduled for a little over a week later). I met with the hiring manager of the department for 30-40 mins, then during that same interview I met with who would be my co-workers if hired. A few days later I received a phone call from the hiring manager to set up another interview with one of the MDs in the department along with the program coordinator of NPCs. This last interview was mainly them telling me what they do and how they interact with the NPCs, it was my chance to ask them questions about the position. The next day I received a phone call from HR offering me a position. While I did meet with a lot of people, interviews were almost back to back because I had an empty schedule. The longest wait time between interviews was 8-9 days.
Interview Questions: They ask mainly behavioral questions. They will ask about what you want to do in the future, since they are aware that this is not a long term career.

title: New Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone screen. The interviewer went over my resume and asked questions about my different positions. I explained that I was using the different positions to showcase my skills; since at my last employer I wasn't able to show that I interacted with the public, used Word, Excel and Outlook
Interview Questions: If I understood the role

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: 2 phone interviews with disease group manager, and then 5 in person meetings/interviews with director, and several physicians in the group-  The people weren't trying to test you, but rather, see what kind of person you are, which was refreshing if you actually have interest in the field.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you saw someone do something unethical with regard to research practice ?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: After a phone interview, the interviewer invited me to an on-site talk. The interviewer asked general questions such as why do you want this position and how my college experience was. The interviewer also showed me around the lab.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I first applied to the institute and had contacted the principle investigator. This was followed by phone conversation with myself as well as two of my references. I was then asked to visit the laboratory and give a scientific presentation (about an hour long) on my research area. I got the verbal confirmation of job offer on the same day, and written job offer in next couple of days.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were related to the science that I was doing.

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a very typical interview process. Basic questions and everyone is very nice.  It started with a phone screen and went on to 2 more rounds of interviews after that. Recruiters were easy to deal with and very accommodating!
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to apply for a Development role?

title: Clinical Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I liked the inviting and respectful environment. I was introduced to staff and had a conversation with them. 

They are still interviewing candidates, so I don't yet know if I have been selected or not.
Interview Questions: Why I was interested in the position?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: This process was really interesting. I initially Interviewed for the New Patient Coordinator job position. During the third and last interview the person who was interviewing me felt that a Clinical research coordinator job would be a better fit after a quick review of my resume.Which is interesting because I had only been applying for clinical research positions throughout my job search but I decided to be flexible and apply to the new Patient coordinator position. I was referred to the clinical research manager and within one week I got a quick phone screening with the manager. She invited me for an in person interview for the following week. The following week I went to the interview. I thought the interview went really well. One of the clinical research coordinator gave me a quick tour. I asked him many questions in order to show him my interest in the position At the end of the interview she invited me for another interview where I would be meeting with two doctors. Two weeks later (which is today) I came for my last round of interview. I met with the clinical research director. It was a brief interview. I ended up meeting with two clinical research coordinator they were very nice and provided a lot of information about the job. Finally I met with the last doctor who would interview me. It was more of a conversation but he did ask me basic questions about my goals and why I wanted to work here etc. Overall the interview went really well. A couple of hours after the interview, I got a call from HR with an offer. I am extremely excited about how fast they got back to me.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself doing long term?

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Several round of interviews, via phone and in person. Everyone was relatively nice and welcoming. I met with the direct supervisor then two rounds with other people in the department. Extreme lack of diversity in the entire department
Interview Questions: Simple interview questions

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: It is quite routine. There was a 30 min phone interview, followed by an one-day onsite interview including an one hour presentation and 30min personal interview for the whole day. After a few days, I was made an offer and I accepted it. Then I believe I have to go though background check. There is a mandatory health clearance requirement.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, what do you know about ...?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were two different phone interviews with the hiring manager. No interview with an HR representative. I then had two different days of in-person interviews with members of the team I would be working with as well as physicians.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: New Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, received an email that someone from hr would call me for a phone interview, that went well and was then asked to come and meet in person. I meet with HR and then waited around to meet with the manager of the department I would be working with. I came in for another interview round and met with the manager as well as a current employee who spoke with me about a typical day, and I was able to ask questions. I received an email the next day as a thanks for interviewing but that they have chosen to pursue other candidates.
Interview Questions: Provide a specific example of when you had to advocate for a patient.

title: New Patient Coordinator Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was a bit awkward- Applied online. After few days, I received an email to schedule a phone interview. The pre-screening  interview was easy, she asked basic questions such as how you handle customers, weakness and goals- Nothing difficult. After few more days, I received an email with a link requesting to submit a list of references with a questionaire. I felt this part of the process was out of the ordinary and strange. My references had to respond within 24 hours frame an automate questionnaire and provide feedback about my work ethics. When the questions were completed,  I received an email confirming a face- to-face interview. During the interview, the interviewer was very pleasant to talk to. The questions were based on how you deal with difficult customers/patients, flexibility in the workplace, multitask, organization skills,  stressful situations, how you deal with pressure, etc. I had the impression the interview went well, until few more days went by and I received an email with "No offer". At this point, I'm not sure what they are looking for.  
The process should be modified- They should ask for references when someone is being hired not during the interview process!
Interview Questions:
Tell me a time when you demonstrated flexibility.
Tell me a time when you provide excellent customer service to a client/patient. 
How do you handle multiple assignments or tasks?

title: New Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: First, I met with a recruiter for an interview then I was sent to meet with another individual who supervises the position. Overall, every person I came in contact with at Dana-Farber was extremely friendly.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how did you handle it?

title: Clinical Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very organized. I met with Human Resources, they did an intense interview to see where I best fit. This was then followed by an interview with the program manager of my department and an interview by the staff
Interview Questions: What has been a stressful past experience?

title: Clinical Administrative Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I initially interviewed for a temporary position to cover an employee's maternity leave. I went directly through DFCI and not a temp agency. I interviewed with the department director, as well as my direct manager. I only had one in person interview.
Interview Questions: They were interested in hearing about my plans for the future, as they expect employees to remain in their roles for about 2 years.

title: Research Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Contacted for an interview and came in person to meet and review job.  They were very upfront about the nature of the work itself.  Most of the interview hinged on my personal goals, what I was looking for in a job and how Dana Farber could meet those needs.  I felt comfortable, listened to and like they were being up front and honest.  In the end it was not a good fit for my specific career aspirations.
Interview Questions: What are my career aspirations

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty straightforward. I met with what would have been my direct supervisor first. She asked me a bit about what I knew about Dana Farber, explained the department and the work the department does, how each department is organized, and gave me the opportunity to ask questions. After that I met with the other CRC's who were very nice, and asked me a couple of questions about my experience and why I applied, I then met with the Director, who asked similar questions
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here?
What are your long term goals?
Questions about experience and background

title: Clinical Administrative Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I did a phone interview then was asked to interview in person two different times. i never heard back either way. I had to call and email to find out, i did not get the job. Very unorganized hiring process. The right hand does not know what the left hand is doing.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I got the job internally, I was a current employee. I submitted my resume, interviewed with two managers together and then met with two senior clinical research coordinators to learn more about the job. The overall experience was a positive one.
Interview Questions: How did I handle a stressful situation at work?

title: Clinical Administrative Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone briefing to in person with HR and then met with two separate floors with openings. I was there for almost 3 hours meeting with different people. Had a final interview with one floor a few days later. The interviews were very informal.
Interview Questions: How are you with managing time when different things are going on around tou?

title: Human Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute
Interview Descriptions: The process took some time since the Human Research Department did their own hiring process. I applied online and a few weeks later was contacted for an in-person interview. The interview was pretty easy and relaxed and everyone there is extremely friendly. Despite being one of the top three candidates, I did not receive an offer.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted directly by the hiring manager and not HR. I was contacted via email and not via phone.  The interviewer spent a LOT of time talking, more than necessary. She explained the entire job description very thoroughly both other the phone and in person. The in person interview was about an hour of 1:1 conversation surrounding my skills and experience. She did follow a template of interview questions and took notes throughout.
Interview Questions: Do you feel comfortable working with individuals that may lose their battle with cancer?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed to have a 15-30 minute phone interview for a Research Technician position. It took about ten days for me to hear back from them. Instead of Human Resources contacting me, the Research fellow contacted me directly via email for a phone interview. We set up the interview on the day of contact. It was a thorough interview, asking questions on lab techniques and standard "where do you see yourself in four years?" and "what are your two greatest weaknesses?".
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in four years?

title: Senior Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (Boston, MA)
